title: U.S. construction : annual spending in public and private sectors 1998 to 2018
summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 2 lines namely Public sector, and Private sector. The y axis represents Value in billion USD and the x axis represents Year.
Overall Public sector, and Private sector are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Value in billion USD in descending order is: 1. Private sector, and lastly, 2. Public sector.
Overall across the Year, Private sector mostly maintained the highest Value in billion USD when compared to others with a mean value of 717.86, and it peaked at '18.
Public sector mostly had the least Value in billion USD with a mean value of 254.33, which peaked at '09 with a value of 315.0.
Public sector reported the lowest Value in billion USD about 155.0 in Year '98
The greatest difference of Value in billion USD between Public sector and Private sector occurs at Year '18 and the smallest difference occurs at '10.
